REUTERS/Fabrice Coffrini/Pool MOSCOW (Reuters) - Relations between Russia and the United States are at the lowest level since the Cold War, the Interfax news agency reported on Tuesday, citing Sergei Ryabkov, Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister.
Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov looks on at the start of two days of closed-door nuclear talks at the United Nations offices in Geneva October 15, 2013.
The RIA news agency also quoted Ryabkov as saying Russia would analyse signals and approaches stemming from the debut Donald Trump's address to the Congress.
(Reporting by Aleksandar Vasovic; Editing by Polina Devitt)
